column1: Logan City is a local government area situated within the south of the Brisbane metropolitan area in South East Queensland
column2: Australia. Situated between the City of Brisbane to the north and the City of Gold Coast to the south
column3: the City also borders the Scenic Rim Region
column5: and Redland City LGAs. Logan City is divided into 70 suburbs and 12 divisions; a councillor is elected to each of the latter. The area had a population of 326
column6: 615 in June 2018.Gaining significant area in 2008 from the amalgamation of parts of the Albert and Beaudesert Shires

column8: south to Mundoolun near the Albert River
column9: east to Carbrook at the Logan River
column10: and west to Lyons. Logan City is located across parts of the sub-basin of Oxley Creek
column11: and the Logan and Albert Rivers. The Daisy Hill Koala Centre serves as an example of Logan's prominent bushland
column13: and the Tamborine and Venman Bushland National Parks

column11: Eagleby and the rural towns of Jimboomba and Logan Village The city facilitates much of the transport between Brisbane and the Gold Coast. Its motorway network is extensive: in the city's north-east
column12: the Logan Motorway joins the Pacific Motorway

column17: Luke Smith was elected mayor of Logan. On 2 May 2019
column18: Minister for Local Government Stirling Hinchliffe sacked the Logan City Council after eight of its Councillors and suspended mayor were charged with one count of fraud. The suspended Mayor was also charged with two counts of misconduct. The council was under administration until March 2020 elections.

column19: Scenic Rim Regional Council and the Tweed River Valley.The Commandant of the Moreton Bay Penal Settlement
column21: was a compulsive explorer and in 1826 on his first expedition he discovered the Logan River. He noted the river was well suited to large-vessel traffic and was a first-class avenue to access the high-quality arable land along its banks. He named the country Darling
column22: in honour of the Governor. The Governor renamed the river after Logan.

column1: The penal settlement based in Brisbane was closed in 1841 and the land was quickly taken up by squatters. The first leases of land in the Logan area were issued from 1849 and immigration was encouraged following the separation from NSW in 1859. The declaration of the Logan and Eight Mile Plains Agricultural Reserves in 1862 led to extensive settlement of the area. German immigrants arrived in batches from the 1864 onwards. Generous land orders for immigrants in Queensland created a drawcard in the possibility of owning their own farm.A cotton gin
column2: which was converted to a sugar mill
column3: was built at Loganholme in 1867. Cotton growers faced problems with both the weather and a lack of available labour despite the introduction of Kanaka labour. By the 1870s few working cotton plantations remained along the Logan River. While this crop was marginally successful
column5: sugar was soon to become the staple industry.

column1: Many small sugar mills were started by farmers seeking to avoid processing costs charged by big mills.  However these quickly proved to be uneconomic.  Many farmers in the area abandoned sugar after a severe frost in 1885 and a catastrophic flood in 1887 which saw crops destroyed and covered with metres of silt.  Others continued growing sugar cane to make 1890 one of the best harvests ever.The Wild Water Water Slide Park began operations in October 1982.  The site was to become the Logan Hyperdome with the first work on the regional shopping centre beginning in October 1988. It was officially opened in July 1989.  Construction work on the Logan Hospital started in February 1989. In August 2011
column2: the Logan suburb of Slacks Creek was the location for Queensland's worst house fire.In 2017
column3: a water treatment plant at Round Mountain became the first in Australia to be powered entirely off-grid.

column1: The Department of Local Government instigated the formation of the new Logan Shire
column2: which included the northern suburbs of both Albert and Beaudesert Shires. A section in the north previously belonged to the Shire of Tingalpa.  There were about 69
column3: 000 people living to the north of the Logan River. On 31 May 1978 Local Government Minister Russ Hinze introduced the Local Government (Adjustment of Boundaries) Bill and which was officially approved on 8 June 1978. Logan then was declared a city on 1 January 1981 and the administration building on Wembley Road was opened in February 1981.

column1: The city was named after Captain Patrick Logan
column2: one of the founders of the Moreton Bay convict settlement. Logan was honoured in the names of many locales in the district
column8: the Logan Motorway and Logan Road
column9: which connects Logan City with the nearby state capital of Brisbane.

column1: With the major changes to local government in Queensland which took effect at 15 March 2008 local elections
column2: Logan more than tripled in area and added 78
column3: 400 people to its population. This came about through annexing a large section of the now-dissolved Shire of Beaudesert as well as the Beenleigh-Eagleby suburban area to its southeast
column4: which had been part of the Gold Coast. In its rationale for the changes
column5: the Local Government Reform Commission argued that the area added brought the South East Queensland urban footprint and future growth areas to 2026 under the one local government
column6: which could plan effectively for the area's future and would face reduced compliance costs for development works. Economic factors
column7: the lack of geographic barriers and the presence of transport corridors were also considered to be favourable to the annexation. Consideration was given to a merger with Redland to its east
column8: but geographical barriers and the lack of a community of interest between them militated against this.

column1: The city has a higher rate of multicultural diversity than the Queensland average. About one quarter of Logan's residents were born overseas. In 2016
column2: it had an unemployment rate of 5.61%
column3: lower than the Queensland average of 6.2%.According to the 2016 census
column5: 386. The median age was 34 years old
column6: 4 years younger than the nationwide median. The male-to-female ratio was 49.4-to-50.6.

column1: The most commonly nominated ancestries were English (26.7%)
column2: Australian (24.0%)
column5: and German (3.9%). 65.8% of people were born in Australia

column10: and Samoa (0.7%). Indigenous Australians accounted for 3.2% of the population.

column1: The most commonly spoken languages other than English were Samoan (1.4%)

column1: Logan City Council is divided and consists of 12 councillors and a popularly elected mayor. Councillors are not officially endorsed by political parties
column2: but are required to declare current memberships of political parties
column4: associations and trade or professional organisations.

column1: Berrinba East State School opened on 24 January 1978.Browns Plains State School opened on 24 January 1983.Kingston College (originally Kingston State High School) was opened in 1978. It now caters for seven to year twelve and a continuing education campus.

Logan City Special School caters for students from Early Childhood to Year twelve. It opened on 1 January 1972.Logan Reserve State School opened on 1 January 1868 and caters for students from Prep to Year 6 School with a C&K Kindy on site.Logan Village State School caters for students from Prep to Year six and opened in March 1872.The Centre Education Programme caters for students from Year 7 to Year 12.

column1: Logan City is serviced by Queensland Rail's Beenleigh and Gold Coast railway lines. The stations are Trinder Park
column2: Woodridge
column7: Holmview and Beenleigh although Gold Coast trains stop only at Beenleigh and Loganlea stations. Integrated ticketing was introduced in South East Queensland in 2004 through TransLink which has improved access to public transport. TransLink bus routes now service most of the built-up areas of Logan City.

column1: Logan City Bus Service is a bus operator
column2: servicing places between Brisbane and Gold Coast at Logan City. First operated as Greenline Bus Service
column3: it was purchased by Clark's Bus Service in 1987. Further development included the purchasing of Rochedale Bus Service in 1995. The trading name of Logan City Bus Service was adopted in 2003. Logan City Bus Service operates a number of services under the TransLink banner
column4: in which most services are based around the Loganholme and Springwood bus stations along the Pacific Motorway
column5: and the Browns Plains bus station further west. They also operate peak hour buses between Logan City and Brisbane City.
